discover.instruction: Read about Tom's daily routine. Notice the highlighted verbs.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о распорядке дня Тома. Обрати внимание на выделенные глаголы.

content.text: I <highlight>wake up</highlight> at 7 every day. My sister <highlight>wakes up</highlight> at 8. We <highlight>eat</highlight> breakfast together. She <highlight>drinks</highlight> coffee, but I <highlight>drink</highlight> tea. After breakfast, I <highlight>go</highlight> to work. I <highlight>work</highlight> in an office. My job <highlight>starts</highlight> at 9 and <highlight>finishes</highlight> at 5. I <highlight>like</highlight> my job because I <highlight>help</highlight> people.
content.question: Look at the verbs with 'I' and 'she'. What is different?
content.question_ru: Посмотри на глаголы с 'I' и 'she'. В чём разница?

points.example: I wake up at 7. She goes to school.
The sun rises in the east. Water boils at 100°C.
I work. They play. We eat.
He works. She plays. It rains.

points.rule: Spelling: -es after s, sh, ch, x, o
points.rule_ru: Правописание: -es после s, sh, ch, x, o
points.example: go → goes, watch → watches, finish → finishes
study → studies, fly → flies (but: play → plays)

notice.instruction: Find ALL Present Simple verbs. Mark if they have -s or not.
notice.instruction_ru: Найди ВСЕ глаголы в Present Simple. Отметь, есть ли у них -s.

tasks.text: Tom gets up early every morning. He has breakfast at 7:30. He usually eats toast and drinks orange juice. Then he goes to school by bus. School starts at 8:30. His mother works in a bank. She leaves home at 8 and comes back at 6. She loves her job. Tom's father doesn't work. He stays at home and cooks dinner.

notice.reflection_question: When do we add -s to verbs?

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct form of the verb.

questions.explanation: My brother = He, so we need 'plays' (verb + s)

produce.instruction: Write 5-7 sentences about your daily routine using Present Simple.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши 5-7 предложений о своём распорядке дня, используя Present Simple.
prompts: What time do you wake up?
What do you eat for breakfast?
What do you do in the evening?
What do you do on weekends?
produce.example: I wake up at 7 every day. I have breakfast at 7:30. I usually eat eggs and drink tea. I work in an office. My job starts at 9. I finish work at 6. In the evening, I watch TV or read books. On weekends, I meet my friends.
criteria: Uses time expressions (every day, usually, always)

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with many Present Simple verbs.

texts.title: My Morning Routine
texts.content: I wake up at 6:30 every day. I take a shower and get dressed. I have breakfast at 7. I usually eat cereal and drink coffee. I leave home at 7:30. I take the bus to work. The bus comes at 7:40. I arrive at work at 8:15. My work starts at 8:30. I work until 5.

texts.title: My Sister's Life
texts.content: My sister lives in Paris. She works as a designer. She loves her job. She wakes up early every day. She goes to the gym before work. She eats healthy food. She doesn't eat fast food. She speaks French and English. She travels a lot. She visits us every summer.

texts.title: Weekends
texts.content: I love weekends! On Saturday, I sleep late. I don't wake up early. I meet my friends in the afternoon. We go to a cafe. We drink coffee and talk. On Sunday, I stay home. I clean my apartment. I watch movies. I cook dinner. I relax.

texts.title: My Job
texts.content: I work in a school. I teach English. I love my job. I start work at 8. I teach three classes every day. My students study hard. They do homework every day. I correct their work. I help them learn. I finish work at 3. I go home and rest.

texts.title: Family Habits
texts.content: My family has different habits. My father wakes up very early. He runs every morning. My mother doesn't like running. She does yoga. My brother plays video games. He plays for hours! My sister reads books. She reads one book every week. I watch TV. We all have dinner together at 7.

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"She don't like pizza."

grammar_cards.back:
I don't work here.

(I/You/We/They + don't + base form)

Does she speak French?

(Does + she + base form)

He goes to school.

(go → goes for he/she/it)

She studies hard.

(study → studies: y → ies)

common_errors: Wrong spelling: studys instead of studies
